name: Data Retrieval & Database
description: Sector template for data retrieval patents including databases, search, indexing, and information retrieval.
contextDescription: Data retrieval patents cover database systems, search engines, and information retrieval. Key areas include query optimization (G06F16/24*), indexing (G06F16/22*), distributed databases (G06F16/27*), and search (G06F16/9*). High-value targets include Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server, AWS databases, Google search, and modern systems like MongoDB, Elasticsearch, Snowflake.
scoringGuidance: Query optimization patents are fundamental to all database systems.
Distributed database patents (sharding, replication) apply to modern cloud databases.
Search/indexing patents may read on search engines and enterprise search platforms.
Consider both traditional RDBMS and NoSQL implementations.
Real-time analytics patents target high-growth markets (Snowflake, Databricks).

questions.question: How relevant is this patent to database management systems (RDBMS, NoSQL, NewSQL)?
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify specific database systems or vendors that would implement this.

questions.question: Does this patent address query optimization, execution planning, or indexing strategies?
questions.reasoningPrompt: Query optimization is universal in databases. Assess optimization techniques.

questions.question: Does this patent apply to distributed databases, data lakes, or cloud data platforms?
questions.reasoningPrompt: Distributed systems are the future of data. Assess scalability aspects.

questions.question: Does this patent improve search, full-text retrieval, or semantic search capabilities?
questions.reasoningPrompt: Search is embedded in many applications. Assess search/retrieval aspects.
